line_1: Since I best revenge my Wrongs
line_2: If I meet with railing Tongues,

line_1: And, such their ardour, rous'd by sense of wrongs,
line_2: To Cuzco's gate advance increasing throngs,

line_1: Behold the fiends of strife avenge their wrongs:
line_2: PERUVIA'S hapless tribes in scatter'd throngs,

line_1: Which loads my length'ning years with wrongs.
line_2: No guilt so black as thine belongs,
All the terrors of our tongues.
But Fame (quoth he) with all her Tongues,

line_1: None silence, who design no wrongs;
And vindicate a world's long suffer'd wrongs.
line_2: Assert an empire which to ALL belongs,

line_1: But what our follies cause, or mutual wrongs;
line_2: Scarcely an ill to human life belongs,
